We know what happens when you hear the words “water shoes.” The first thing that comes to your mind is an image of dorky, awkward, cloth sacks for your feet that your mom made you wear on family vacations. Lucky for you, fashion moves quickly, and it didn’t leave water shoes behind.  Now there are tons of options for the best water shoes for men depending on your lifestyle, whether you’re someone who needs traction for constant outdoor adventuring or you just need a little extra stability.  We’ve compiled a list of the best water shoes for men with different specifications and tech to fit a wide range of different needs. Keep reading to see our selections and find the pair that’s right for you. Strap on these shoes and get exploring. In This ArticleOur PicksWhat To Look ForWater Shoes for Men FAQs aleaderzone / Instagram Best Water Shoes For Men: Under Armour Men’s Kilchis Shoes  Different activities often require different specifications and tech to achieve the best results, but with Under Armour’s Men’s Kilchis Shoes you can rest assured that you’re not sacrificing performance for versatility. These shoes may have a similar look and construction to a regular sneaker, but are designed for much more.  Made with a contoured midsole and footbed for rapid drainage, as well as abrasion and water resistant overlays, these shoes are quick-drying for maximum comfort and breathability, and their gripping sole will make sure you have the traction you need for whatever adventure you may face.  These shoes are best to pair with your technical gear or beach attire – especially helpful when your hunter instincts kick in while gathering mussels for dinner (just us dreaming of steamed mussels on the beach?).  Sizes available: 8-14 | Colors: Black, green, gray, white, + | Activity: Running, hiking, boating Best Slip-On Water Shoes: Merrell Men’s Hydro Mocs Adventuring is rarely easy, so why not take advantage of a pair of shoes that does some of the work for you? That pair of shoes is Merrell’s Men’s Hydro Mocs. This easy slip on and off shoe is designed to carry you wherever you need to go, and the ventilation holes on the top of the shoe allow for maximum breathability.  Pair these with the heel strap, contoured arch-supporting design, and EVA material, and you have a pair of the best water shoes for men that will make you feel like you’re not wearing anything on your feet at all. Seen on countless celebrities as of late, don’t sleep on these shoes even for your quick grocery runs or weekend antiquing. To complete the look, pair these with a pair of straight cut, loose jeans, a dad hat, plaid/ t-shirt and vest to live your true midwest fantasy.  Sizes available: 7-15 | Colors: Black, beige, green, blue, + | Activity: Hiking, swimming, kayaking Best Lace Up Water Shoes: Crocs Men’s LiteRide 360 Pacer Sneaker  Crocs have come a long way since the irreverent classic clog, and their Men’s LiteRide 360 Pacer Sneaker are the best proof of it. These are the best water shoes for men who need multi-terrain footwear but are reluctant to give away their favorite pair of sneakers.  Like classic Crocs, these Crocs alternatives have built in ventilation ports on both the top of the foot and the side for breathability as well as water drainage. With a lace up construction for an adjustable fit and a thick, cushioned sole, these sneakers are designed to provide you maximum comfort no matter where you go.  If you’re a fan of the ever-classic dad shoes (ahem, like me) then please stop, click and shop.  Sizes available: 2-17  | Colors: Black, white, beige, red | Activity: Hiking, walking, boating Best Floating Shoes: Crocs Classic Clog  While the Croc Classic Clog may get a bad rep from internet trolls, there’s no denying that these shoes get the job done and unless you’ve been living with your head under a rock you know these bad-boys are back with a vengeance.  These comfortable clogs are made of a lightweight but durable rubber material that protects your foot while making sure you don’t get weighed down, and constructed with holes on the top for maximum water drainage and breathability.  With their adjustable strap that can convert for an extra layer of back of the heel support, these shoes allow you to customize your wearing experience. The best part? Their weight of only a few ounces means they easily float, so you can have peace of mind if one goes rogue during your kayaking or rafting adventures.  Sizes available: 4-17  | Colors: Black, brown, pink, yellow, + | Activity: Boating, kayaking Best Cheap Water Shoes: DLGJPA Men’s Lightweight Quick Drying Aqua Water Shoes   Just because you’re on a budget doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice the best quality and protection in your outdoor gear. That’s where DLGJPA Men’s Lightweight Quick Drying Aqua Water Shoes come in. These sneaker-like shoes are crafted with hydrophobic mesh fabric and an anti-slip outer sole, so you don’t have to worry about comfort and safety in and out of the water.  Pair that with an easily adjustable elastic lace, as well as a heel tab that makes taking them on and off easy, these are the best water shoes for men on the go who are also on a budget.  We like to think of these as the car-boat hybrid of shoes. Simple enough to pair with a casual outfit for brunch (open button-up shirt, plain tee and some colorful 5 inch shorts anyone?) and then still be ready for a game of catch at the beach after.  Sizes available: 7-14  | Colors: Gray, black, yellow, blue, +  | Activity: Hiking, boating, walking  Best Water Hiking Shoes: The North Face Men’s Skagit Water Shoe When you’re hiking through tough conditions, you need a no-slip, no-nonsense shoe that can take you where you need to go. Look no further than The North Face’s Men’s Skagit Water Shoe.  These low-top, sneaker-like shoes are constructed with The North Face’s trademarked EXTS outsole, so you can be confident that your shoes have the best grip no matter the terrain.  These shoes work even if you’re only looking to pair them with your top-notch gorp-core while you pick up bagels and coffee for breakfast. Our favorite is a light puffer jacket or vest with some soft joggers – if you’re in need of some inspiration.  With a removable footbed insert for comfort, quick-drying mesh as the upper fabric, and a built-in midsole drainage system, these are the best water shoes for men that want to hike, no matter your favorite trail conditions.  Sizes available: 7-14  | Colors: Black/blue, gray/yellow | Activity: Hiking Best Water Shoes For Swimming: Nike Swim Fins If you’re looking for the best water shoes for men to not only protect your feet, but add to your performance, then look no further than Nike’s Swim Fins. These water shoes are designed with your performance in mind, with a shorter than average fin that provides just-as-powerful kicks without getting in your way.  Their open toe construction allows for breathability out of the water, while the buoyant, rubber material is quick drying. Pop on these fins and let them help shave seconds off your time.  Ok, yes what you’re thinking is correct, these are not the most stylish shoes. I would not recommend wearing these to meet your girlfriend’s parents for the first time. However, slap these bad boys on with your best swim trunks before challenging her brother to a race and you’ll be the true weekend warrior. That’s where Land’s End’s Sneaker Water Shoes come in. These best water shoes for men are as supportive and protective as they are durable and quick-drying, giving you the best of both worlds.  The EVA footbed is designed for maximum shock-absorption, so you can take these from the boat, to the beach, to the backwoods without a second thought. Add to that an easily adjustable pull-tab lace and a traction-increasing rubber outsole, you get the best of both worlds in comfort and performance.  Personally I would pair these with a classic pair of chinos (shorts or pants, choose your own adventure) and a graphic tee to be ready for any situation.  Sizes available: 8-13 | Colors: Navy | Activity: Walking, hiking Best Closed Toe Water Shoes: Lands’ End Sport Slip On Water Shoes  The Land’s End Sport Slip On Water Shoes have the classic, slim water shoe look combined with ultimate modern comfort technology. These closed-toe shoes are designed to hug the feet for a streamlined look and for optimal performance, while also providing a cushioned footbed for protection.  Add to this an adjustable locking bungee ankle closure and an entirely polyester and mesh blend fabric, these slip-on water shoes are comfortable, breathable, and quick-drying all in one package.  I would recommend keeping these close to the beach or as the perfect pair of dingy shoes as you motor back to the boat (if we could all be so lucky…no need to brag).  Sizes available: 8-13 | Colors: Navy, black | Activity: Swimming, boating, kayaking, walking Best Shoes For Water Sports: Xero Shoes Aqua X Sport Water Shoes  If you’re looking for a pair of water shoes to get you through the harsh conditions and strain of water sports, look no further than Xero Shoes Aqua X Sport Water Shoes. These low-top sneakers are slim-fit to provide the most natural movement possible while providing maximum support.  Their FeelTrue rubber soles are as flexible as they are non-slip, so you don’t have to sacrifice movement for support and protection. With quick-dry lining and a midfoot strap for even more support, you can take your game to the next level with these shoes. Sea Star’s Beachwear Beachcomber Espadrille Water Shoes are here to strike the perfect balance. Made in a classic and stylish espadrille design, these shoes have the perfect resort wear look and feel.  These shoes are made of a neoprene upper which has a rapid dry time of just 15 minutes in direct sunlight, so you’re guaranteed quick comfort both in and out of the water. The perfect pair to throw on before a last-minute getaway or impromptu beach day. The 100% neoprene upper is both stretchy and breathable, and allows for maximum comfort while they dry. Columbia’s PFG Pro Sport Boot is one of the best water shoes for men for serious anglers ready to conquer the roughest seas.  Their Omni-Grip non-marking traction rubber sole of these boots provides a non-slip grip on slick surfaces, while their Techlite+ insole provides thick, shock-proof cushioning and stability to keep you comfortable on the toughest travels.  Sizes available: 7-15  | Colors: Black, grey ice, cordovan, ancient fossil | Activity: Fishing What to look for when searching for the best water shoes for men Occasion Just like any performance gear, there’s a lot of things to consider when searching for the best water shoes for men. The first key element is occasion—shoes designed for different activities will have different specifics. Water shoes designed for running will have a sneaker-like construction, water shoes designed for hiking will have a thicker fabric and more support, etc. The better you know what these shoes will be used for, the more fitting pair you can find.  Traction When you’re dealing with the slick surfaces that come from any kind of water sports, friction is your best friend (aka, the best water shoes for men, aka why you’re here). Comfort and style are pretty useless unless they can get you from point A to point B. A key feature in testing whether or not a shoe has good traction is looking at the features of the sole. If the sole only has a few ridges, it probably won’t cut it. If the sole has deep cut teeth, then it will sink into and grip mud, rocks, etc. much better.  nortiv8shoes / Instagram Fabric If you’re going in and out of the water frequently, you need to be sure you pick a pair of the best water shoes for men with the most durable fabric so you can use them longer. Water does some serious damage and wears away thin materials like canvas and suede, so you’re going to want to steer away from anything not specifically geared to the outdoors. Some of the best materials for water shoes are Gore-Tex and polyvinyl chloride.  FAQ Just like any outdoor or exercising gear, water shoes have a tendency to retain odor quicker than other articles of clothing. Luckily you probably have the proper cleaning tools right in your kitchen already. Mix a half a cup of baking soda with some dish soap in warm water, and use a sponge or toothbrush to scrub the shoes inside and out. Water does some serious damage and wears away thin materials like canvas and suede, so you’re going to want to steer away from anything not specifically geared to the outdoors. Some of the best materials for water shoes are Gore-Tex and polyvinyl chloride.
